Search results

rotate

Treat a list/vector as a circular data structure and rotate it by n places: (rotate 0 [1 2 3 4]) ;=> [1 2 3 4] (rotate 2 [1 2 3 4]) ;=> [3 4 1 2] (rotate -1 [1 2 3 4]) ;=> [4 1 2 3] Note, coll should be countable.

File: overtone/algo/lists.clj Line: 6 

      (defn rotate
  "Treat a list/vector as a circular data structure and rotate it by n
   places:

   (rotate 0  [1 2 3 4]) ;=> [1 2 3 4]
   (rotate 2  [1 2 3 4]) ;=> [3 4 1 2]
   (rotate -1 [1 2 3 4]) ;=> [4 1 2 3]

   Note, coll should be countable."
  [n coll]
  (let [size   (count coll)
        offset (mod n size)
        s      (cycle coll)
        s      (drop offset s)]
    (into [] (take size s))))
